{{Infobox person | name = Dominique Cerutti | image = Dominique Cerutti.jpg | image_size = |birth_name = Dominique Cerutti |birth_date = {{birth date|1961|01|03}} |birth_place = |nationality = [[France|French]] | residence = [[France]] | education = [[École Spéciale des Travaux Publics|ESTP]] | alma_mater = | occupation = Chairman and CEO of the Altran group | networth = | religion = | spouse = married | children = 2 | parents = | known_for = | website = }}
'''Dominique Cerutti''' (born January 3, 1961 in [[Manosque]], France) is a French businessman and has been Chairman and CEO of the [[Altran]] group since June 2015.
==Career==
=== Early career === Dominique Cerutti began his career as an engineer for French company [[Bouygues|Bouygues Construction]] in [[Saudi Arabia]], where he was based for nearly two years.
=== IBM === He moved to [[IBM]] in 1986 starting out in sales engineering and sales management. He remained at IBM for more than 20 years.
At IBM, he was promoted to his first management position in 1996 as the Director of Personal Systems Group for Western Europe.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=83421936&ticker=ICE&previousCapId=20571&previousTitle=GANNETT%20CO|title=intercontinentalexchange gro (ICE:New York)|work=Businessweek|date=}}</ref>
Over the following decade, Cerutti ascended the ranks of IBM, and worked in roles that were particularly international. In 1998, he became Executive Assistant to the Chairman and CEO, Lou Gerstner.
In 2000, he moved to IBM Global Services, the leading market services provider in Europe, first as General Manager for Western Europe and then for the whole EMEA region.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=19091455&authType=NAME_SEARCH&authToken=M0Gd&locale=en_US&srchid=2774862811395063981142&srchindex=2&srchtotal=11&trk=vsrp_people_res_name&trkInfo=VSRPsearchId%3A2774862811395063981142%2CVSRPtargetId%3A19091455%2CVSRPcmpt%3Aprimary|title=Dominique Cerutti profile|work=Linkedin|date=}}</ref> He managed tens of thousands of employees in 17 different sectors.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/societes/2009/10/01/04015-20091001ARTFIG00488-dominique-cerutti-rejoint-nyse-euronext-.php|work=Le Figaro|title=Dominique Cerutti rejoint NYSE Euronext |date=October 1, 2009|language=fr}}</ref> In 2005, Cerutti became IBM’s General Manager for Europe, Middle East and Africa.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/0/60a24ba6-aeea-11de-96d7-00144feabdc0.html#axzz2wD2gq890|title=NYSE Euronext picks IBM veteran Cerutti|work=Financial Times|date=}}</ref>
According to his former IBM colleagues, Cerutti starkly contrasted with the company’s generally diffident management style, and preferred to clearly outline strategies for his teams.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usinenouvelle.com/article/dominique-ceruttile-nouveau-profil-d-ibmapres-avoir-conseille-pendant-un-an-lou-gerstner-p-dg-d-ibm-dominique-cerutti-pilote-la-filiale-de-services-informatiques-du-groupe-en-europe.N102980|title=Dominique Cerutti, le nouveau profil d'IBM|work=Usine Nouvelle|date=2001-08-23|language=fr}}</ref>
=== NYSE-Euronext === In 2009 Dominique Cerutti left IBM to join NYSE [[Euronext]], the global exchange group, as President and Deputy CEO. He was also CEO of Euronext NV, the European subsidiary of NYSE Euronext, and Chairman and CEO of Euronext Paris.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/dominique-cerutti/|title=Dominique Cerutti|work=Forbes|date=}}</ref> In 2010, he was appointed as Board Member of the Group.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=a.WEW4C9lqmM|title=NYSE Names Cerutti to Succeed Theodore as Deputy CEO (Update1)|work=Bloomberg|date=2009-10-01}}</ref> He undertook one of his first notable projects as a member of the Board: compliance with the EU’s [[Markets in Financial Instruments Directive]]. According to him, this directive decreased transparency in financial markets by allowing the creation of alternative exchange platforms at a time when “the need for transparence has never been so acute.” <ref>{{Cite web|title = Dominique Cerutti met en garde contre l'opacité des marchés actions|url = http://www.lesechos.fr/29/06/2010/LesEchos/20708-161-ECH_dominique-cerutti-met-en-garde-contre-l-opacite-des-marches-actions.htm|website = lesechos.fr|accessdate = 2015-11-26}}</ref>
In November 2013, he moved up from Deputy CEO of NYSE to become the CEO of Euronext.
In June 2014, he oversaw Euronext’s [[Initial public offering|IPO]] as an independent company after it separated from parent company ICE. As CEO of Euronext, he turned around the strategy of the group, moving away from the legacy of his predecessor, Jean-François Théodore.<ref name=":0" /> In September 2014, he embarked on a program to increase operational savings by €60 million over the next three years, with the goal of achieving a 5% annual revenue growth and improve the company's long-term [[EBITDA]] margin from 42% to 53%.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.thetradenews.com/news/Asset_Classes/Equities/Cerutti_outlines_multi-asset_class_vision_for_Euronext.aspx|title = Cerutti outlines multi-asset class vision for Euronext|date = June 10, 2014|accessdate = October 13, 2014|website = Trade News|publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref>
Cerutti has also spoken against the European Commission's proposal of a [[Financial-transactions tax|financial transactions tax]], arguing that "the political intention of creating such a tax is a noble one, but the current form of the proposal is counter-productive […] this tax is truly the last thing we need now.“<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url = http://www.leadersleague.com/news/view/id/795c276142f14a11e9de0d3977815f34|title = Portrait : Dominique Cerutti, CEO, Euronext|date = September 26, 2014|accessdate = October 13, 2014|website = Leaders League|publisher = |last = |first = |deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20141018052436/http://www.leadersleague.com/news/view/id/795c276142f14a11e9de0d3977815f34|archivedate = October 18, 2014|df = }}</ref> He has also spoken out in favor of increased market regulation and transparency as the main way of reducing risk.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.leadersleague.com/news/view/id/54ab112d5a151b8c5d3293623a9bbff4|title = Dominique Cerutti (Euronext) : "Se repositionner comme un centre majeur de levée de capitaux"|date = September 24, 2014|accessdate = October 13, 2014|website = Leaders League|publisher = |last = |first = |deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20141018052340/http://www.leadersleague.com/news/view/id/54ab112d5a151b8c5d3293623a9bbff4|archivedate = October 18, 2014|df = }}</ref>
During his time as CEO, Euronext once again became independent and had an IPO in its own markets.<ref name=":1" /> According to Rijnhard Van Tets, president of Euronext's Surpervisory Board, "Under his direction, the company was able to successfully re-position itself as the leading independent European stock market." <ref>{{Cite web|title = Dominique Cerutti va quitter Euronext pour diriger Altran|url = http://www.ladepeche.fr/article/2015/04/22/2092196-dominique-cerutti-va-quitter-euronext-pour-diriger-altran.html|website = ladepeche.fr|accessdate = 2015-11-27}}</ref>
=== Altran === Dominique Cerutti has been Chairman and CEO of the [[Altran]] group since 18 June 2015.
In November 2015, Dominique Cerutti announced his five-year strategic plan, "Altran 2020. Ignition." The plan aims for the firm to reach 3 billion euros in revenue in five years and a big increase in profitability.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Altran voit les choses en grand pour 2020|url = http://www.lesechos.fr/tech-medias/hightech/021503433116-altran-voit-les-choses-en-grand-pour-2020-1177808.php?XF5S6o3QZLTYxjph.99|website = lesechos.fr|access-date = 2016-02-01|language = fr-FR}}</ref> <ref>{{Cite web|title = Altran dévoile son plan stratégique : « Altran 2020. Ignition »|url = http://www.altran.fr/actualites/actualites-france/2015/altran-devoile-son-plan-strategique-altran-2020-ignition.html#.Vq8kDfQrKHt|website = www.altran.fr|access-date = 2016-02-01|language = fr|first = |last = }}</ref> As part of the new strategic plan, Dominique Cerrutti launched a strong acquisition policy, notably with Tessella, an international leader in data analysis and data science consulting, Synapse, an American company specialized in developing innovative products, Lohika, a software engineering company and Benteler Engineering, a German firm specialized in design and engineering services for the automobile industry.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zonebourse.com/ALTRAN-TECHNOLOGIES-4610/actualite/Altran-Technologies-finalise-les-acquisitions-de-SWELL-et-de-BENTELER--23563142/|title=Altran Technologies : finalise les acquisitions de SWELL et de BENTELER|publisher=Zone Bourse|date=16 December 2016}}</ref>
Dominique Cerrutti also set up several strategic partnerships, especially in the fields of 3D printing,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://video.lefigaro.fr/figaro/video/dominique-cerutti-avec-l-imprimante-3d-il-sera-possible-de-creer-un-habitat-sur-mars/5021321869001/|title=Dominique Cerutti : "Avec l'imprimante 3D il sera possible de créer un habitat sur Mars"|publisher=Le Figaro}}</ref> with Divergent an American startup that integrates 3D printing with automobile manufacturing,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lepoint.fr/automobile/actualites/impression-3d-pour-l-automobile-altran-investit-dans-divergent-07-09-2016-2066519_683.php|title=Impression 3D pour l'automobile: Altran investit dans Divergent|publisher=Le Point|date=7 September 2016}}</ref> and autonomous driving with EMG (eMApgo) a Chinese company specialized in digital mapping for the automobile industry.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lepoint.fr/automobile/actualites/altran-s-allie-avec-une-entreprise-chinoise-specialisee-dans-la-cartographie-numerique-04-01-2017-2094556_683.php|title=Altran s'allie avec une entreprise chinoise spécialisée dans la cartographie numérique|publisher=Le Point|date=4 January 2016}}</ref>
In 2017, he led Altran’s acquisition of Information Risk Management (IRM), a UK-based company specialized in cyber security, as well as GlobalEdge, an India-based software solutions firm specialized in IoT systems and embedded software solutions.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.euroinvestor.fr/actualites/2017/07/28/altran-technologies-altran-acquires-information-risk-management-irm-a-cyber-security-consultancy-based-in-the-uk/13646321|title=ALTRAN TECHNOLOGIES : Altran acquires Information Risk Management (IRM), a Cyber Security consultancy based in the UK|publisher=Euroinvestor|date=28 July 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.consultancy.uk/news/14012/indian-software-services-firm-globaledge-acquired-by-altran|title=Indian software services firm GlobalEdge acquired by Altran|publisher=Consultancy|date=28 September 2017}}</ref>
In November 2017, under the leadership of Dominique Cerruti, Altran Group also purchased the company [[Aricent]] for $2.0 billion, which is to date, the Group’s largest acquisition. This move enabled “Altran 2020. Ignition” strategic plan to achieve its goals two years ahead of schedule and established the company as a world leader in engineering, research and development services.<ref>[http://www.business-standard.com/article/companies/altran-buys-out-aricent-from-kkr-for-2-billion-117113000869_1.html France's Altran buys out Aricent from KKR for $2 bn], Business Standard, December 1, 2017</ref><ref>[https://www.lesechos.fr/tech-medias/hightech/030960044570-altran-change-dechelle-avec-lacquisition-daricent-2134642.php Altran change d'échelle avec l'acquisition d'Aricent], Les Echos, November 30, 2017</ref> Under Cerutti, Altran published revenues for the year 2017 indicating a 10% increase in sales, as well as a current operating income up by 13.6% that year; an increased revenue margin of 10.8%.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/press-releases/2018-02-28/altran-technologies-full-year-results-2017-the-ignition-transformation-bears-its-fruits|title=Full Year results 2017: the "Ignition" transformation bears its fruits|publisher=Bloomberg|date=28 February 2018}}</ref>
In June 2018, Dominique Cerutti announced the plan "The High Road, Altran 2022". This plan ambitions a 14.5% margin and a 4 billion euros turnover in 2022 by betting on technological breakthroughs.<ref>[https://fr.reuters.com/article/businessNews/idFRKBN1JO206-OFRBS Altran vise 14,5% de marge en 2022 en pariant sur les ruptures technologiques], Reuters, june 28, 2018</ref>{{,}}<ref>[https://www.lesechos.fr/tech-medias/hightech/0301893645105-le-plan-daltran-pour-accroitre-ses-revenus-dun-tiers-en-cinq-ans-2188169.php Le plan d'Altran pour accroître ses revenus d'un tiers en cinq ans], les Echos, june 28, 2018</ref>
== Honors & Awards == The French weekly news magazine, ''Option Finance'', named Dominique Cerutti in its ranking of the top 50 newsmakers of 2014.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|title = Les 50 qui ont fait l’actualité en 2014|url = http://www.optionfinance.fr/entreprises-finance/communaute-financiere/les-50-qui-ont-fait-lactualite-en-2014.html|website = www.optionfinance.fr|accessdate = 2015-11-26}}</ref>
== Family background and personal life == Dominique Cerutti is married and the father of two children. He is passionate about jogging and diving.<ref name=":0" />
==References== {{reflist}}

[[Winterthur Museum, Garden and Library|Winterthur Mansion and Gardens]] ([[Winterthur, Delaware|Winterthur]]) | meaning = Du Pont, "Of the bridge" }} The '''Du Pont family''' ({{IPAc-en|dj|uː|ˈ|p|ɒ|n|t}})[http://www.dictionary.com/browse/dupont "DuPont"]. ''[[Random House Webster's Unabridged Dictionary]]''. is an [[United States|American]] family descended from [[Pierre Samuel du Pont de Nemours]] (1739–1817). Since the 19th century, the Du Pont family has been one of the richest families in America.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/du-pont/|title=Du Pont family|work=forbes.com|accessdate=9 October 2016}} Many former Du Pont family estates have been opened to the public as museums, gardens, or parks, such as [[Nemours Mansion and Gardens]], [[Longwood Gardens]], and [[Winterthur Museum, Garden and Library]]. The family's first American estate, located at [[Hagley Museum and Library]], has been designated a [[National Historic Landmark]]. In recent years, the family has continued to be known for its association with political and business ventures, as well as philanthropic efforts on behalf of various organizations such as [[The Jockey Club]],{{cite web|title=Lunger Estate Makes Major Contribution to Equine Research|url=http://www.jockeyclub.com/default.asp?section=Resources&area=0&archives=show&story=194|website=The Jockey Club|accessdate=18 April 2015}} the [[Philadelphia Orchestra]],{{cite news|last1=Duvoisin|first1=Marc|title=Family's Reach Influenced Business, Politics And Arts The Du Pont Family Can Take Some Credit For The Creation Of Longwood Gardens, The Atomic Bomb And Nylon Hosiery.|url=http://articles.philly.com/1996-01-28/news/25653867_1_du-pont-eleuthere-irenee-pont-iv|accessdate=18 April 2015|publisher=The Philadelphia Inquirer|date=28 January 1996}} the [[Delaware Art Museum]], and the [[Grand Opera House (Wilmington, Delaware)|Grand Opera House]].{{cite web|last1=Nagengast|first1=Larry|title=The Past, Present and Future of DuPont|url=http://www.delawaretoday.com/Delaware-Today/April-2014/The-Past-Present-and-Future-of-DuPont/index.php?cparticle=7&siarticle=6#artanc|publisher=Delaware Today|accessdate=18 April 2015}} Two family members were the subjects of well-publicized criminal cases. Heir [[John Eleuthère du Pont]] was convicted of murdering wrestling coach [[Dave Schultz (wrestling)|Dave Schultz]] in 1996{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/12/10/sports/olympics/10dupont.html|title=John E. du Pont, Heir Who Killed an Olympian, Dies at 72|date=10 December 2010|publisher=|accessdate=9 October 2016|via=The New York Times}} and heir [[Robert H. Richards IV]] was convicted of raping his 3-year-old daughter in 2009.{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/02/justice/delaware-du-pont-rape-case/index.html|title=Du Pont heir convicted of rape spared prison - CNN.com|first=By Kevin Conlon and Stephanie Gallman|last=CNN|work=cnn.com|accessdate=9 October 2016}} The family is depicted in the 2014 biographical film ''[[Foxcatcher]]'' with [[Steve Carell]] playing [[John Eleuthère du Pont]] and [[Vanessa Redgrave]] playing [[William du Pont, Jr.#Marriages, family, and career|Jean du Pont]], the wife of [[William du Pont, Jr.]] The family fortune as of 2016 was $14.3 billion with over 3,500 living members around the world, most of whom are only marginally related. ==History== [[Pierre Samuel du Pont de Nemours]] was the son of a Parisian watchmaker and a member of a [[Duchy of Burgundy|Burgundian]] [[Huguenot]] family, and descendant of a minor [[nobility|noble family]] on his mother's side. He and his sons, [[Victor Marie du Pont]] and [[Éleuthère Irénée du Pont]], emigrated from France in 1800 to the United States and used the resources of their Huguenot heritage to found one of the most prominent of [[United States|American]] families, and one of its most successful [[corporation]]s, [[DuPont|E. I. du Pont de Nemours and Company]], initially established by Éleuthère Irénée as a gunpowder manufacturer. In 1802, Éleuthère Irénée du Pont established a gunpowder mill on the banks of the [[Brandywine Creek (Christina River)|Brandywine River]] near [[Wilmington, Delaware]]. The location provided all the necessities to operate the mill: a water flow sufficient to power it, available timber (mainly willow trees) that could be turned into charcoal fine enough to use for gunpowder, close proximity to the [[Delaware River]] to allow for shipments of sulfur and saltpeter, the other ingredients used in the manufacture of gunpowder. There were also nearby stone quarries to provide needed building materials.{{cite web|url=http://americanroads.net/happy_trails.winter2014.htm|title=Happy Trails|work=americanroads.net|accessdate=9 October 2016}} Over time the [[DuPont|Du Pont company]] grew into the largest black powder manufacturing firm in the world. The family remained in control of the company up through the 1960s{{cite news|title=DuPont Co.'s 19 leaders since 1802|url=http://www.delawareonline.com/story/news/local/2015/10/05/duponts-leaders/73422578/|accessdate=27 October 2015|work=Wilmington News Journal}} and family trusts still own a substantial amount of the company's stock. This and other companies run by the Du Pont family employed up to 10 percent of Delaware's population at its peak.{{cite news|last1=Gross|first1=Scott|title=Delaware's dilemma: A fading DuPont|url=http://www.delawareonline.com/story/money/industries/2015/10/23/delawares-dilemma-fading-dupont/74329022/|accessdate=27 October 2015|work=Wilmington News Journal}} During the 19th century, the Du Pont family maintained their family wealth by carefully arranged marriages between [[inbreeding|cousins]][http://discovermagazine.com/2003/aug/featkiss Go Ahead, Kiss Your Cousin] by Richard Conniff, From the August 2003 issue, published online August 1, 2003 which, at the time, was the norm for many families. The family played a large part in politics during the 18th and 19th centuries and assisted in negotiations for the [[Treaty of Paris (1783)|Treaty of Paris]] and the [[Louisiana purchase]]. Both [[T. Coleman du Pont|T. Coleman]] and [[Henry A. du Pont]] served as U.S. senators, and [[Pierre S. du Pont, IV]] served as Governor of Delaware. The family has also played an important role in historic preservation and land conservation, including helping to found the [[National Trust for Historic Preservation]], preserving President [[James Madison]]'s home [[Montpelier (Orange, Virginia)|Montpelier]], and establishing numerous museums such as Winterthur and the [[Delaware Museum of Natural History]]. The Brandywine Conservancy founded by family member [[George Alexis Weymouth]] owns around {{convert|2350|acres|0|abbr=on}} of land in Pennsylvania and Delaware, and owns permanent conservation easements on an additional {{convert|37000|acres|0|abbr=on}}.{{cite news|last1=Bauers|first1=Sandy|title=Conservancy gains easement Winterthur's pastoral beauty is now protected|url=http://articles.philly.com/2002-07-25/news/25358114_1_winterthur-henry-f-du-pont-easement|accessdate=27 October 2015|work=The Philadelphia Inquirer|date=25 July 2002}}{{cite news|last1=Montgomery|first1=Jeff|title=The Brandywine Conservancy: Preserving Nature, Art, and History|url=http://php.delawareonline.com/news/assets/2014/09/WIL_1001_BRANDYWINE_CONSERVANCY_.pdf|accessdate=27 October 2015|work=Wilmington News Journal}} In 2013, [[Lammot du Pont Copeland]]'s [[Mt. Cuba Center]] contributed over $20 million to purchase land for donation to the federal government to form the [[First State National Historical Park]].{{cite web|url=http://www.conservationfund.org/projects/woodlawn-property-a-new-national-park-in-delaware/|title=Delaware's First State National Monument|accessdate=6 November 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141031235716/http://www.conservationfund.org/projects/woodlawn-property-a-new-national-park-in-delaware/|archivedate=31 October 2014|df=}} Beginning with [[William du Pont, Jr.]] and his sister, [[Marion duPont Scott]], many members of the Du Pont family have been involved in the breeding and racing of [[thoroughbred]] [[horse racing|racehorses]], as well as establishing racehorse venues and training tracks.{{cite web|url=http://emc.vetmed.vt.edu/emcmariondupontscott.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20011227114730/http://emc.vetmed.vt.edu/emcmariondupontscott.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=27 December 2001|title=Marion duPont Scott Equine Medical Center|publisher=University of Vermont|accessdate=9 October 2016}} ==Spelling of the name== The stylings “Dupont”, “DuPont”, du Pont" and "Du Pont" for the family name have both been widely used in published writings. In many publications, the styling is "du Pont" when quoting an individual's full name and "Du Pont" when speaking of the family as a whole, although some individual Du Ponts have chosen to style it differently, such as [[Samuel Francis Du Pont]]. The name of the chemical company founded by the family is today styled solid as "[[DuPont]]" in the short form (but the long form is styled as E. I. du Pont de Nemours and Company); the stylings "Du Pont" and "DuPont" for the company's short name coexisted in the 20th century, but the latter is now consistently used in the company's branding. The solid styling "duPont" is less common, but the [[Nemours Alfred I. duPont Hospital for Children]] uses it, as does the [[duPont Registry]]. William S. Dutton's mid-20th-century history of the family business{{Citation |last=Dutton |first=William S. |year=1942 |title=Du Pont: One Hundred and Forty Years |publisher=Charles Scribner's Sons |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=WEtZAAAAYAAJ |lccn=42011897 |postscript=.}} uses "Du Pont" both for the family mentioned generally and for the company's short name but "du Pont" in an individual's full name (for example, "[[Éleuthère Irénée du Pont]]", "[[Henry du Pont]]", "[[Alfred V. du Pont |Alfred Victor du Pont]]", "[[Lammot du Pont I|Lammot du Pont]]"); for example, "when he [Lammot du Pont] went to General Henry du Pont with the proposal that the Du Ponts manufacture dynamite, he was answered by a blunt and unqualified 'No!'"{{rp|116}}) The first page of Dutton's monograph{{rp|3}} contains the following footnote about the surname's styling (the mention of "Samuel Dupont" here refers to the 18th-century Parisian watchmaker, not to [[Samuel Francis Du Pont|his 19th-century descendant]]): "Samuel Dupont used this form of the family name [i.e., Dupont], but beginning in 1763 [[Pierre Samuel du Pont de Nemours|his son]] signed himself 'Du Pont.' Later, he added 'de Nemours' to his name to prevent confusion with two other Duponts in the [[Chamber of Deputies (France)|French Chamber of Deputies]]. Du Pont, in English, is pronounced with the accent on the second syllable. In French, neither syllable is accented."{{rp|3}} [[French orthography|French orthographic]] tradition for the styling of ''de'' (or its inflected forms) as a surname particle, in either nobiliary or non-nobiliary form, is discussed at ''[[Nobiliary particle#France|Nobiliary particle § France]]''. In non-nobiliary form, the prevalent French styling of the name is "[[Wiktionary:Dupont|Dupont]]", and thus the choice by Pierre Samuel du Pont de Nemours to begin styling himself so during the monarchical era hints at social ambition. But the influence of French orthography and prerevolutionary class structure on how [[English orthography]] styles surnames today is outweighed by how families and individuals so named style themselves. ==Alphabetical list of selected descendants of Pierre Samuel du Pont de Nemours== {{unreferenced section|date=November 2017}} Below is an alphabetical listing of selected notable members of the family. It is followed by a listing of their families in order of descent. The listing is intended only to illustrate the relationships among the notable members of the family and is not a complete genealogy. The only family groupings and lines of descent shown are those necessary to illustrate relationships for notable members of the family. By 1942 there were believed to be 705 direct descendants of [[Pierre Samuel du Pont de Nemours]], and in the 21st century there are well more than 2,000 living members of the family. {{Columns-list|colwidth=30em| *[[A. {{Accounting}} '''Earnings management''', in [[accounting]], is the act of intentionally influencing the process of [[financial reporting]] to obtain some private gain.<ref name = "S 1989">Schipper, Katherine. 1989. “Commentary on Earnings Management.” ''Accounting Horizons'' (December): 91–102.</ref> Earnings management involves the alteration of [[financial reports]] to mislead [[Stakeholder (corporate)|stakeholders]] about the organization's underlying performance, or to "influence contractual outcomes that depend on reported accounting numbers."<ref name = "HW 1999">Healy, Paul M., and James M. Wahlen. 1999. “A Review of the Earnings Management Literature and Its Implications for Standard Setting.” ''Accounting Horizons'' 13 (4): 365–383.</ref>
Earnings management has a negative effect on [[earnings quality]],<ref name=NYSSCPA>{{cite web|last1=Akers|first1=Michael D.|last2=Giacomino|first2=Don E.|last3=Bellovary|first3=Jodi L.|title=Earnings Management and Its Implications: Educating the Accounting Profession|url=http://www.nysscpa.org/cpajournal/2007/807/essentials/p64.htm|work=The CPA Journal|publisher=The New York State Society of CPAs|accessdate=14 January 2014}}</ref> and may weaken the credibility of [[financial reporting]].<ref name="M 1999">{{cite web|last=Munter|first=Paul|title=SEC Sharply Criticizes "Earnings Management" Accounting|url=http://www.csus.edu/indiv/l/lundbladg/ACCY%20113/113_WA/SEC%20Sharply....pdf|accessdate=14 January 2014|year=1999|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120905162446/http://www.csus.edu/indiv/l/lundbladg/ACCY%20113/113_WA/SEC%20Sharply....pdf|archivedate=5 September 2012|df=}}</ref> Furthermore, in a 1998 speech [[Securities and Exchange Commission]] chairman [[Arthur Levitt]] called earnings management "widespread".<ref name="SEC Speech 1998">{{cite web|title=Remarks by Chairman Arthur Levitt|url=https://www.sec.gov/news/speech/speecharchive/1998/spch220.txt|publisher=SEC|accessdate=14 January 2014}}</ref> Despite its pervasiveness, the complexity of accounting rules can make earnings management difficult for individual investors to detect.<ref name = "Investopedia What" />
== Occurrence and response by regulators == Earnings management is believed to be widespread. A 1990 report on earnings management situations stated that "short-term earnings are being managed in many, if not all companies",<ref name=NYSSCPA /> and in a 1998 speech, [[Securities and Exchange Commission|Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)]] chairman [[Arthur Levitt]] called earnings management a "widespread, but too little-challenged custom".<ref name="SEC Speech 1998" /> In a 2013 essay, [[Ray J. Ball|Ray Ball]], while opining that [[accounting research]] was not reliably documenting earnings management, wrote: "''Of course'' earnings management goes on. [...] People have been tried and convicted."<ref name = "Ball 2013">{{cite journal|last=Ball|first=Ray|title=Accounting Informs Investors and Earnings Management is Rife: Two Questionable Beliefs|journal=Accounting Horizons|year=2013|volume=27|issue=4|pages=847–853|doi=10.2308/acch-10366}}</ref>
The SEC has criticized earnings management as having adverse consequences for financial reporting, and for masking "the true consequences of management's decisions".<ref name="SEC Speech 1998" /> It has called on standard-setters to make changes to [[accounting standards]] to improve [[financial statement]] transparency, and has called for increased oversight over the financial reporting process.<ref name="M 1999" /> The SEC has also pressed charges against the management of firms involved in [[fraud]]ulent earnings management.<ref>{{cite web|title=SEC Charges Former Chief Accounting Officer of Beazer Homes for Fraudulent Earnings Management Scheme|url=https://www.sec.gov/news/press/2009/2009-146.htm|publisher=SEC|accessdate=14 January 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=COMMISSION CHARGES TWO FORMER BRISTOL-MYERS OFFICERS FOR FRAUDULENT EARNINGS MANAGEMENT SCHEME|url=https://www.sec.gov/news/press/2005-118.htm|publisher=SEC|accessdate=14 January 2014}}</ref>
== Motivations and methods == {| class="toccolours" style="float: right; margin-left: 1em; margin-bottom: 1em; font-size: 85%; background:#c6dbf7; color:black; width:25em; max-width: 40%;" cellspacing="5" | style="text-align: left;" | "Increasingly, I have become concerned that the motivation to meet Wall Street earnings expectations may be overriding common sense business practices. Too many corporate managers, auditors, and analysts are participants in a game of nods and winks. In the zeal to satisfy consensus earnings estimates and project a smooth earnings path, wishful thinking may be winning the day over faithful representation."<ref name="SEC Speech 1998"/> |- | style="text-align: left;"|—[[Arthur Levitt]], in a speech to the NYU Center for Law and Business, 28 September 1998. |} Earnings management involves the manipulation of company earnings towards a pre-determined target. This target can be motivated by a preference for more stable earnings, in which case management is said to be carrying out ''income smoothing''.<ref name="Investopedia What">{{cite web|title=What is earnings management?|url=http://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/191.asp|publisher=Investopedia|accessdate=14 January 2014}}</ref> Opportunistic income smoothing can in turn signal lower risk and increase a firm's market value.<ref name="S 1996">{{cite journal|last=Subramanyam|first=K. R.|title=The pricing of discretionary accruals|journal=Journal of Accounting and Economics|year=1996|volume=22|pages=249–281|doi=10.1016/s0165-4101(96)00434-x}}</ref> Other possible motivations for earnings management include the need to maintain the levels of certain [[financial ratio|accounting ratios]] due to [[debt]] covenants, and the pressure to maintain increasing earnings and to beat analyst targets.<ref name = "RTW 2002">{{cite journal|last=Richardson|first=Scott A. |author2=A. Irem Tuna |author3=Min Wu|title=Predicting Earnings Management: The Case of Earnings Restatements|journal=|date=October 2002|ssrn=338681}}</ref>
Earnings management may involve exploiting opportunities to make accounting decisions that change the earnings figure reported on the [[financial statements]]. Accounting decisions can in turn affect earnings because they can influence the timing of transactions and the estimates used in financial reporting. For example, a comparatively small change in the estimates for [[Bad debt|uncollectible accounts]] can have a significant effect on [[net income]], and a company using [[FIFO and LIFO accounting|last-in, first-out accounting]] for [[inventories]] can increase net income in times of rising prices by delaying purchases to future periods.<ref name=Primer>{{cite web|last=Weil|first=Roman L.|author-link=Roman L. Weil|title=Quality of Earnings and Earnings Management: A Primer for Audit Committee Members|url=http://www.aicpa.org/ForThePublic/AuditCommitteeEffectiveness/AuditCommitteeBrief/DownloadableDocuments/Audit_Committee_Quality_of_Earnings.pdf|publisher=AICPA|accessdate=14 January 2014}}</ref>
== Detecting earnings management == Earnings management may be difficult for individual investors to detect due to the complexity of accounting rules,<ref name = "Investopedia What" /> although [[accounting research]]ers have proposed several methods.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Price lll|first1=Richard A.|last2=Sharp|first2=Nathan Y.|last3=Wood|first3=David A.|title=Detecting and Predicting Accounting Irregularities: A Comparison of Commercial and Academic Risk Measures|journal=Accounting Horizons|date=December 2011|volume=25|issue=4|pages=755–780|doi=10.2308/acch-50064|url=http://www.aaajournals.org/doi/abs/10.2308/acch-50064|accessdate=28 July 2016}}</ref> For example, research has shown that firms with large [[accruals]] and weak governance structures are more likely to be engaging in earnings management.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Prawitt|first1=Douglas F.|last2=Smith|first2=Jason L.|last3=Wood|first3=David A.|title=Internal Audit Quality and Earnings Management|journal=The Accounting Review|date=July 2009|volume=84|issue=4|pages=1255–1280|doi=10.2308/accr.2009.84.4.1255|url=http://www.aaajournals.org/doi/abs/10.2308/accr.2009.84.4.1255|accessdate=28 July 2016}}</ref><ref name="DS 2000">{{cite journal|last=Dechow|first=Patricia|author2=Douglas J. Skinner|title=Earnings Management: Reconciling the Views of Accounting Academics, Practitioners, and Regulators|journal=Accounting Horizons|year=2000|volume=14|issue=2|pages=235–250|url=http://www.emeraldinsight.com/bibliographic_databases.htm?id=1347061&show=abstract|doi=10.2308/acch.2000.14.2.235}}</ref> More recent research suggested that linguistics-based methods can detect financial manipulation, for example studies in 2012 found that whether a subsequent irregularity or deceptive restatement occurred is related to the linguistics used by top management in [[earnings call|earnings conference calls]].<ref name="LZ 2012">{{cite journal|last=Larcker|first=David F.|author2=Anastasia A. Zakolyukina|title=Detecting Deceptive Discussions in Conference Calls|journal=Journal of Accounting Research|year=2012|volume=50|issue=2|pages=495–540|doi=10.1111/j.1475-679x.2012.00450.x}}</ref><ref name="HMV 2012">{{cite journal|last=Hobson|first=Jessen L. |author2=William J. Mayew |author3=Mohan Venkatachalam|title=Analyzing Speech to Detect Financial Misreporting|journal=Journal of Accounting Research|year=2012|volume=50|issue=2|pages=349–392|doi=10.1111/j.1475-679x.2011.00433.x}}</ref>
== Further reading == * Vladu, A. B., Amat, O., & Cuzdriorean, D. D. (2014). [http://repositori.upf.edu/bitstream/handle/10230/22658/1434.pdf?sequence=1 Truthfulness in accounting: How to discriminate accounting manipulators from non-manipulators], Economics Working Papers 1434, Department of Economics and Business, Universitat Pompeu Fabra.

{{ad|date=June 2015}} {{Infobox summit | summit_name = Emerging Kerala | other_titles = | image = Emergingkeralalogo.jpg | alt = | caption = "Come. Experience. And be part of it" | chairperson = [[Government of Kerala]] | country = [[India]] | date = 12–14 September 2012 | venues = [[Le Méridien]], Kochi | cities = [[Kochi]], [[Kerala]] | participants = | follows = | precedes = | website = {{URL|http://www.emergingkerala2012.org}} }}
'''Emerging Kerala''' is the name given to a biennial investors summit held by the [[Government of Kerala]] in [[Kerala]], [[India]]. The event is aimed at bringing together business leaders, investors, corporations, thought leaders, policy and opinion makers; the summit is advertised as a platform to understand and explore business chances in the State of [[Kerala]].
==Investment Options==
Twenty-six sectors have been identified and the following Project profiles have been prepared by various Departments, PSUs & other agencies for showcasing in 'Emerging Kerala 2012'<ref>http://www.emergingkerala2012.org/sectors.php</ref>
* Tourism * Healthcare services * Manufacturing including Engineering & Automotive * Projects under MSME Sector * IT / ITES / IT Infrastructure * Science & Technology * Trade & Retailing * Food & Agro Processing and Value-addition * Ports, Shipbuilding * Textiles & Garments * Electronics * Knowledge / Education sector * Green Energy * Bio-Technology, Nano Technology, Pharmaceuticals * Urban Infrastructure Development * Infotainment * Logistics * Petrochemicals * Gas based Industries * Airport Infrastructure, Aeroplane & Helicopter services * Centres of Excellence * Infrastructure development (Road, Rail, Power, Water Supply, Sewage)
== Emerging Kerala Global Connect 2012 == The first edition of Emerging Kerala summit, was held from September 12 to 14, 2012 at the Le Meridien International Convention Centre, [[Kochi]]. The event was organised by the [[Kerala State Industrial Development Corporation]] (KSIDC), to highlight investment opportunities available in [[Kerala]] and advertise to the world its state of readiness to receive investors.<ref>http://www.ndtv.com/article/south/emerging-kerala-investment-meet-to-see-51-nations-taking-part-261487</ref> The Hon'ble [[Prime Minister of India]] [[Manmohan Singh|Dr. Manmohan Singh]] inaugurated the three-day event.<ref>http://www.ndtv.com/article/south/prime-minister-to-inaugurate-emerging-kerala-meet-on-september-12-258673</ref> <ref>http://www.thehindu.com/news/cities/Kochi/article3788382.ece</ref>
Several programmes were organised in connection with and running up to Emerging Kerala 2012.<ref>http://www.emergingkerala2012.org/about-us.php</ref>
These include:
* Business meets * Sectoral conclaves; * Domestic and international road-shows * Discussion and debates
Besides the inaugural session, the first Global connect had
* Plenary Sessions * Sectoral presentations; * Round tables. * Business to Business (B2B) connects; * Business to Government (B2G) connects. * Cultural performances
The Event as well as its associated programmes had the support of the [[Government of Kerala]] (GoK) and [[Kerala State Industrial Development Corporation|KSIDC]], in addition to various Trade and Industrial bodies. The [[Confederation of Indian Industry]] (CII) and National Association of Software & Services Companies ([[NASSCOM]]) were the event partners.
'''Outcomes of the meet'''
The meet could bring in 45 specific project proposals with an investment of over Rs.40,000 crore, including [[Bharat Petroleum]] Corporation Ltd’s [[Kochi Refinery]] expansion and another joint venture project of Rs.18,000 crore; [[Volkswagen]]’s engine assembly unit (Rs.2,000 crore); hospital and pre-cast concrete structure manufacturing unit (Rs.570 crore); and solar energy plant (Rs.500crore).<ref>http://www.thehindu.com/news/states/kerala/article3898219.ece</ref>
The [[Confederation of Indian Industry]](CII) had announced the setting up of a Centre of Excellence in Entrepreneurship in the State. During the meet, 43 business proposals were discussed between different departments of the State and companies from the [[U.K.]], the [[U.S]], [[Japan]], and [[Canada]].
[[The Kerala State Investment Board]] will be set up by the [[Government of Kerala]] to speed up clearance for proposals. Necessary amendments would be made to the single-window clearance Act, including making the application process online.
The [[Kerala Industrial Infrastructure Development Corporation]] (KINFRA) would create one lakh sq ft built-up space in 16 months for incubators and complete the first phase of 25,000 sq ft by May 2013, making the world’s largest telecom incubator. The State government plans to strengthen the entrepreneurial ecosystem by creating Technology Innovation Zone on about 10 acres in [[Kochi]] at an initial investment of Rs.100 crore.
==Mega Projects==
A number of Mega projects are being conceptualized and developed in the State, the most prominent of which are as follows:<ref>http://www.emergingkerala2012.org/mega-projects.php</ref>
'''Supplementary Gas Infrastructure Project'''
A Joint Venture Company, [[Kerala Gail Gas Limited]] (KGGL) has been formed between [[Kerala State Industrial Development Corporation|KSIDC]] and M/s. [[GAIL]] Gas Limited. KGGL will take up activities like City Gas Distribution in Kerala, CNG Stations for [[Kerala State Road Transport Corporation|KSRTC]] Buses, establishment of [[Gas Training Institute]], laying of Spur Lines from GAIL's main pipeline, setting up of small Gas based small power generating plants etc. The total investment for the project is estimated at Rs.2,000 Crores ($400 million).
'''[[Vizhinjam International Seaport|Vizhinjam International Deepwater Multipurpose Seaport]]'''
The Vizhinjam International Deepwater Multipurpose Seaport is an ambitious project of [[Government of Kerala]], being developed at [[Vizhinjam]] in [[Thiruvananthapuram]]. The project is proposed to follow Landlord Port Model, where dredging, reclamation and basic infrastructure like construction of break-water and quay will be done by [[Vizhinjam International Seaport Ltd]]. (a company fully owned by Govt of Kerala). Port Operation will be on [[public–private partnership]] (PPP) model. Terminal superstructure will be built by private operator who will also operate and maintain it for 30 years. The port development along with the external infrastructure work is envisaged to be carried out in phases with the cumulative cost estimated at around Rs. 7000 Crores ($1.4 billion). The port is envisaged to provide in total 2000m of quay length in three phases and is designed to cater primarily for containers transshipment, besides providing for other type of cargo such as Multi-Purpose, Break Bulk.
'''[[Kochi Metro|Kochi Metro Rail Project]]'''
The Project envisages construction of a world-class Light Mass Rapid Transit System in [[Kochi]] to enhance the quality of life for the Greater Kochi metro area by improving regional connections and reducing overcrowding, traffic congestion, transit time, air and noise pollution. The Project, having a total route length of 25 km would be having 21 stations, from [[Aluva]] to [[Pettah, Thiruvananthapuram|Pettah]]. The construction methodology proposed is elevated viaduct carried over pre-stressed concrete ‘U’ shaped girders. A Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) by the name ‘[[Kochi Metro Rail Limited]]’ has been formed for the implementation of the project. The estimated project cost is Rs. 4500 Crores ($900 million).
'''[[Thiruvananthapuram Monorail|Monorail Project in Thiruvananthapuram]]'''
This is a prestigious single-rail mass transit project of Government of Kerala having a route length of 28.4 km, connecting the towns of [[Kazhakoottam]] and [[Balaramapuram]] in [[Thiruvananthapuram district]]. Monorail is a rail-based transportation system based on a single rail, which acts as its sole support and guideway. The rail will be straightened on a track upon the median that divides the main road. Concerns like land acquisition will be minimum, as only junctions are needed to be widened to incorporate the passage. The running train is to consist of four cars capable of carrying more than 200 persons at a time. The trains would breeze past through the elevated rails at a safe speed of 40Kmph. The total project cost is estimated at Rs. 3408 Crores ($682 million). The detailed Traffic study on the project is being done by [[National Transportation Planning & Research Centre]] (NATPAC).
'''Other projects'''
* Petroleum Chemicals & Petrochemical Investment Region ([[PCPIR]]) * Kochi-Palakkad National Investment and Manufacturing Zone ([[NIMZ]]) * [[Indian Institute of Information Technology, Kottayam]] (IIIT) * High Speed Rail Corridor (HSRC)from [[Thiruvananthapuram]] to [[Kasargode]] * [[Sea Plane]] Services in Kerala * Electronic Hub at [[Kochi]] * [[Titanium Sponge]] Project * [[Oceanarium]] Project at Kochi * [[Life Sciences Park]] at Thiruvananthapuram * Gas Based Power Project at [[Cheemeni]]

'''Esteban José Handal Pérez''' (born 7 January 1965 in [[San Pedro Sula]]) is a Honduran politician and businessman who is also known as the "Red Bull."<ref name="LT">[http://www.latribuna.hn/web2.0/?p=132337 La Tribuna (Honduras), 16 May 2010, accessed 27 July 2010]</ref> He is the former President of the Liberal Youth of Honduras and previously sought the nomination to be a Honduran Presidential candidate on behalf of the Liberal Party. He served in the national parliament of Honduras from 1997 to 2001. He is currently leader of the United Liberal Movement and has announced that he will seek the leadership of the Liberal Party in the internal elections scheduled for 2012.
==Biography== Esteban José Handal Pérez was born in San Pedro Sula, in the department of Cortes, Honduras.
==Education== Handal Pérez studied at the International School in Sampedrana in his home city. He completed his studies at the [[University of Texas]] and the [[Louisiana State University]], graduating in Industrial Engineering in 1987.
==Political career== Shortly after his graduation from University, Handal returned to Honduras and became involved in politics supporting the then presidential candidate of the Liberal Party, Carlos Roberto Flores in 1989, although Roberto Flores lost to the National Party candidate, Rafael Leonardo Callejas. Handal was elected President of the Liberal Youth of San Pedro Sula in 1989. Subsequently he was campaign coordinator for Ramon Villeda Bermudez and in August 1993 participated in the Congress of Liberal Youth where he was elected president of the Liberal Youth, serving until 2001. In 1997 he won the nomination for Congress and was elected in the [[Honduran general election, 1997|1997 General election]] for the constituency of Cortes.<ref>[http://www.latribuna.hn/web2.0/?p=137520 Interview in La Tribuna, 29 May 2010] accessed 26 July 2010</ref>
During his time as deputy, he emphasized always being firm with his convictions, but shortly after winning the Provincial Council, he was nominated by the Liberal Party as a presidential candidate with the "New Generation" movement. {{Citation needed|date=July 2010}} During his presidential campaign, people began calling him "the Red Bull," a nickname that is recognized throughout Honduras.
During his presidential campaign, Mr. Esteban Handal Perez revamped "the renewal of the Liberal Party of Honduras with young men and women in thought, the democratization of the Liberal Party, the rescue of the liberal principles, and the guarantee of food, health, education, employment, security, and shelter for all Hondurans," among other things. {{Citation needed|date=July 2010}}
In the internal elections of the Liberal Party on 3 December 2000, Esteban Handal Pérez, the "Red Bull", received 150,000 votes, which no were not sufficient at that time to win the nomination for the Presidency by the Liberal Party. Professor Rafael Pineda Ponce lost in the general election to Ricardo Maduro Joest of the National Party. After the elections, Esteban Handal temporarily retired from politics to dedicate himself to pastoral and entrepreneurial work.
On 16 May 2010, he publicly announced in an interview with "La Tribuna," a newspaper, his intention to return to national politics and run for the Presidency as a Liberal. He justified his return with the sentiment that "the Honduran people need profound changes in the political system and also because I believe that there should be a greater social awareness by large majorities"<ref>[http://www.latribuna.hn/web2.0/?p=132337 Vuelve el "Toro Colorado"]</ref> and their lack of involvement in the events of 28 June 2009. Mr. Handal Pérez currently leads the Liberal Unity Movement and has publicly declared its intention to run in the presidential elections in 2012, with the intentions of "the construction of a new Honduras, with more opportunities for all, more democratic, more free, more developed, more just, and more worthy." {{Citation needed|date=July 2010}}

{{Refimprove|date=May 2015}} The '''European Federation of [[Financial Analyst]]s Societies''' ('''EFFAS''') is the federation of [[financial analyst|analysts]] associations in Europe. EFFAS comprises 21 member societies representing more than 14,000 investment professionals. EFFAS was founded in 1962 and the headquarters is located in [[Frankfurt]], [[Germany]].
Besides its European training programme CEFA (Certified European Financial Analyst) EFFAS also grants the Certified Environmental Social and Governance Analysts (CESGA) designation, ensuring professional qualification by offering global as well as local market knowledge within its examination structure. EFFAS also provides services for capital market experts through the national member societies.

{{no footnotes|date=December 2013}} '''Gerard J. Tellis''' is professor of [[marketing]], Neely Chair of American Enterprise, and director of the [[Center for Global Innovation]] at the [[Marshall School of Business]], the [[University of Southern California]], Los Angeles, California.
==Education== He holds a bachelor's degree in chemistry from the [[University of Bombay]], a postgraduate diploma in [[Business Management]] from Xavier Labor Relations Institute in Jamshedpur, India, and a Ph.D. from the [[University of Michigan]], Ann Arbor.
==Academia== He has been visiting chair of marketing, strategy, and innovation at the [[Judge Business School]], [[Cambridge University]], UK, distinguished visitor, [[Erasmus University]], Rotterdam, and sales development manager for [[Johnson & Johnson]]. Tellis specializes in the areas of global innovation, market entry, new product growth, advertising, promotion, and pricing. He has published widely on these topics in many journals, including the ''[[Journal of Marketing]]'', ''[[Journal of Marketing Research]]'', ''[[Journal of Advertising Research]]'', ''[[Marketing Science (journal)|Marketing Science]]'' and ''[[Sloan Management Review]]''. His research on advertising has been noted in the professional and popular press, both nationally and internationally. He has won several awards for his research and teaching. In particular, he has twice won the [[Maynard Award]] for most significant contribution to marketing thought in the ''Journal of Marketing'', the [[Odell Award]] for best paper in the ''Journal of Marketing Research'', and the [[Bass Award]] for best paper in ''Marketing Science''. His recent book, ''Will and Vision: How Latecomers Grow to Dominate Markets'', (co-authored with Peter Golder), was rated by ''[[Harvard Business Review]]'' as one of the best business books of 2001. He is on the editorial review board of the ''[[Journal of Marketing Research]]''.
== Awards ==
*[[Vijay Mahajan Award]] for Lifetime Contributions to Marketing Strategy from the [[AMA Tech/SIG]], 2006. *[[USC Mellon Award]] for mentoring doctoral students, 2007. *Best Published Article on Global Marketing from [[American Marketing Association Global/SIG]]. 2006 *Best Paper Award, of Product Development and Management Association Award for papers presented at 2005 Research Forum. *Best Published Article on Innovation from [[American Marketing Association Tech-SIG]], 2005. *[[American Marketing Association-Leonard Berry Award]] for best book (Will and Vision) in marketing in the last 3 years, 2004. *[[Impact on Management Practice Award]] by Erasmus University Rotterdam 2004, for research on International Takeoff, published in Marketing Science. *[[Harold D. Maynard Award]] for most significant contribution to Marketing thought among articles published in Journal of Marketing, 2002. *[[Distinguished Alumnus Award]], University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, April 2003. *[[Phi Kappa Phi]] USC Faculty Award for creative works, 2003. *Best paper in [[MSI Conference on Global Marketing]] organized by the [[Marketing Science Institute]] and [[International Journal of Research in Marketing]], 2003. *[[Harvard Business Review]] citation for Will and Vision, as one of the best business books of 2001. *[[Frank M. Bass Outstanding Dissertation Award]], for best article in Marketing Science, 1998. *[[William F. Odell Award]] for best article in Journal of Marketing Research, 1998. *[[Harold D. Maynard Award]] for most significant contribution to Marketing thought among articles published in Journal of Marketing, 2000. *Best Paper Award, [[Marketing Science Institute]]’s Working Paper Series 1993. *Best Paper Award of American Marketing Association Summer Educators’ Conference, 1982. *[[Chester B. Phillips Award]] for Outstanding Teaching as a professor, 1988. *Finalist for [[American Marketing Association Tech/SIG]] award for best paper in innovation, 2006. *Finalist for [[American Marketing Association-Leonard Berry Award]] for best book in marketing for Effective Advertising, 2005. *Semi-Finalist for [[INFORMS Edelman Award]] for Research 2005. *Semi-Finalist for [[INFORMS Wagner Award]] for Research 2005. *Finalist for Best Article Award in the [[Journal of Retailing]], 2004 *Finalist for Best Article of [[AMA Tech SIG]], 2003. *Finalist for the Practice Prize of the [[INFORMS Society of Marketing Science]], 2005. *Finalist for Practice Prize of the [[INFORMS Society of Marketing Science]], 2004. *Finalist for [[William F. Odell Award]] for best article in the Journal of Marketing Research, 2003. *Finalist for [[Paul Green Award]] for best article in Journal of Marketing Research, 2000. *Finalist for [[William F. Odell Award]] for best article in Journal of Marketing Research, 1996. *Finalist for [[John D. C. Little Award]] for best article in Marketing Science, 1995. *Finalist for Best Article in Journal of Advertising, 1995. *Finalist for [[William F. Odell Award]]
== Honors ==
*Faculty Fellow, [[AMA Doctoral Consortium]] **[[Arizona State University]], 2007. **[[University of Maryland, College Park|University of Maryland]], 2006 **[[University of Connecticut]], 2005 **[[Texas A&M University|Texas A&M]], 2004 **[[University of Minnesota]], 2003 **[[Emory University]], 2002 **[[University of Western Ontario]], 2000 **[[University of Southern California]], 1999. **[[University of Georgia]], 1998. **[[University of Illinois]], 1993. **[[University of Southern California]], 1992. **[[Harvard University]], 1990. *Faculty Fellow, [[Marketing Science Doctoral Consortium]], Rotterdam 2004 *[[Beta Gamma Sigma]], [[University of Michigan]], 1984 *Fellow, [[AMA Doctoral Consortium]], 1982.
== Bibliography ==
*''Handbook of Advertising'', published in 2007. Tellis, Gerard J. and [[Tim Ambler]]. [[London, UK]]: [[Sage Publications]]. ({{ISBN|1412918863}}) *''Effective Advertising: How, When, and Why Advertising Works'', published in 2004. Tellis, Gerard J. [[Thousand Oaks, CA]]: [[Sage Publications]]. ({{ISBN|0761922539}}) *''Will and Vision: How Latecomers Grow To Dominate Markets'', published in 2001. Tellis, Gerard J. [[McGraw Hill]]. ({{ISBN|007137549X}}) *''Advertising and Sales Promotion Strategy'', published in 1998. Tellis, Gerard J. [[Reading, MA]]: [[Addison-Wesley]]. ({{ISBN|0321014111}})
Tellis has been on the editorial review boards of the ''[[Journal of Marketing Research]]'', ''[[Journal of Marketing]]'' and ''[[Marketing Science (journal)|Marketing Science]]'' for several years.

He is known for coining the term [[open innovation]].''[[The Guardian]]''. [https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2012/aug/15/crowdsourcing-global-health-research "Crowdsourcing reveals life-saving potential in global health research"]. August 15, 2012. Retrieved on May 30, 2013. == Biography == Chesbrough holds a [[Bachelor of Arts|BA]] in [[Economics]] from [[Yale University]], an [[MBA]] from [[Stanford Graduate School of Business]], and a [[PhD]] from the [[Haas School of Business]] at the [[University of California, Berkeley]]. He taught at the [[Harvard Business School]] as an [[assistant professor]] and Class of 1961 Fellow from 1997 to 2003. He is currently an [[adjunct professor]] and the [[executive director|faculty director]] of the Garwood Center for Corporate Innovation at the [[Haas School of Business]] at the [[University of California, Berkeley]].''[[CBS MoneyWatch]]''. [http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-505125_162-31040215/berkeley-haas-henry-chesbrough-on-open-innovation/ "Berkeley-Haas' Henry Chesbrough on 'Open Innovation'"]. November 26, 2008. Retrieved on May 30, 2013. He acts as the chairman of the Open Innovation Center - Brazil. His first appearance in Brazil was in 2008, when he did a presentation in the Open Innovation Seminar 2008. He also acts as the chairman of board of advisors for Induct Software and appeared in [[Oslo]] on the 2011 Oslo Innovation Week == Publications == * {{cite book |date= 2003 |title= Open Innovation: The New Imperative for Creating and Profiting from Technology |publisher= HBS Press |first= Henry |last= Chesbrough |display-authors= 0 |isbn= 978-1422102831 }} * {{cite book |date= 2006 |title= Open Business Models: How to Thrive in the New Innovation Landscape |publisher= HBS Press |first= Henry |last= Chesbrough |display-authors= 0 |isbn= 978-1422104279}} * {{cite book |date= 2006 |title= Open Innovation: Researching a New Paradigm |publisher= Oxford |first= Henry |last= Chesbrough |display-authors= 0 |isbn= 978-0199226467}} * {{cite book |date= 2010 |title= Open Services Innovation: Rethinking Your Business to Grow and Compete in a New Era |publisher= Jossey-Bass |first= Henry |last= Chesbrough |display-authors= 0 |isbn= 978-0470905746 }} * {{cite book |date= 2014 |title= New Frontiers in Open Innovation |publisher= Oxford |first= Henry |last= Chesbrough |display-authors= 0 |isbn= 978-0199682461 }} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commonscat}} * [http://www.haas.berkeley.edu/faculty/chesbrough.html Henry Chesbrough] at [[Haas School of Business]] * {{google scholar id |_HyypBAAAAAJ }} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chesbrough, Henry}} [[Category:1956 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American business theorists]] [[Category:University of California, Berkeley faculty]] [[Category:Haas School of Business alumni]] [[Category:Harvard Business School faculty]] [[Category:Stanford Graduate School of Business alumni]] [[Category:Yale University alumni]]

'''INROADS''' is a non-profit organization founded in 1970 by Frank C. Carr to fix the lack of ethnic diversity in corporate America.<ref name="InroadsHistory">{{cite web|url=http://inroads.org/about-us/history|title=INROADS History: Celebrating Over Four Decades of Excellence|accessdate=May 10, 2012}}</ref> INROADS originally launched with only 25 interns working at 17 sponsoring corporations in the [[Chicago]] area.<ref name="InroadsHistory"/> Since then, INROADS has expanded to become an international organization serving nearly 2,000 interns annually at over 200 sponsoring corporations.<ref name="InroadsHistory"/> The organization is now based in [[St. Louis, Missouri]].<ref name="InroadsHome">{{cite web|url=http://inroads.org|title=INROADS Home Page|accessdate=May 10, 2012}}</ref>
==Qualifications== INROADS is open to graduating [[high school]] seniors and [[college]] students with two or more years left before they graduate from college. A student must have a [[GPA]] of 3.0 or better if in college.<ref name="InroadsFAQ">{{cite web|url=http://inroads.org/about-us/faqs|title=INROADS Frequently Asked Questions|accessdate=May 10, 2012}}</ref> If the student is a senior in high school they may qualify with a GPA of 3.0 or better and have either an [[ACT (examination)|ACT]] score of 20 or better, [[SAT]] score of 1000 or better, or be ranked in the top ten percent of their graduating class. These qualifications may vary by affiliate however.
==Internships== All the internships offered through INROADS are paid internships though the actual rate of pay varies from company to company. Also in addition to working at the sponsoring company, INROADS interns are required to attend training sessions hosted by INROADS with the purpose of teaching interns business skills. Some of the many sponsoring companies are: [[Boeing|Texas Instruments, Boeing]], [[TD Bank Financial Group]], [[Regions Bank]], [[Liberty Mutual Insurance]], [[Travelers Insurance]], [[Target Corporation|Target]], [[MetLife]], [[Pfizer]], [[Google]], [[Deloitte]], [[PricewaterhouseCoopers]], [[RBC Capital Markets]], [[Sunoco Inc]], [[KPMG]], [[Bridgestone]]/[[Firestone Tire and Rubber Company|Firestone]], [[Allstate|Allstate Insurance]], [[Johnson and Johnson]], [[Coca-Cola]], [[PECO Energy|PECO]], [[The Vanguard Group|Vanguard]], [[United Health Group]], [[United Technologies]] and [[Kraft Foods|Kraft]].

'''Israel Beck''' (1891–1972) was a founding member of the [[Antwerpsche Diamantkring]],<ref name="kring">{{cite web | url=http://diamantkring.org/about-us/history/ | title=History {{Pipe}} The Rough Diamond Bourse |website=[[Antwerpsche Diamantkring]]}}</ref><ref name="syndikaat">{{cite journal |date=January 1973 |title=Overlijden |trans-title=In memoriam |type=Statutory publication |language=nl |periodical=De Belgische Diamantnijverheid |issue=1 |publisher=Syndikaat der Belgische Diamantnijverheid |lay-url=http://www.sbd.be/?q=en/node/10 |place=Antwerp, Belgium |volume=46 |page=3}}</ref> the world’s largest and first-ever diamond bourse to be dedicated to rough [[diamond]]s trade. He was President of the Board from 1961 until his death in 1972.<ref name="kring"/> By that time, he had served benevolently 43 years as a member of the Board, promoting diamond trade internationally and the [[Antwerp diamond district|Antwerp diamond industry]] in particular, and representing the Antwerpsche Diamantkring at the World Diamond Congress.<ref name="syndikaat" />
==Early life== Israel Beck was born in 1891 in [[Sanok]], southern [[Poland]] (a region which was known as [[Galicia (Eastern Europe)|Galicia]]). He married Helena Blitz, with whom he has had three children (Isaac, Edith, and Leopold). In 1907 he joined his future father in law, Louis (Levie) Blitz, to become the third generation of family members in the diamond trade.
==Between World War I and World War II== Israel Beck co-founded the [[Antwerpsche Diamantkring]],<ref name="syndikaat" /> and became in 1929 a member of its first Board of Directors immediately upon its establishment as the first diamond bourse worldwide for rough [[diamond]] trade. By 1932 he opened a new diamond factory with his brother, in the center of the [[Antwerp diamond district|diamond district]] in Antwerp.
==During World War II== Israel Beck and his family fled Belgium during World War II, crossing France and finding shelter during the final years of the war as refugees in [[Geneva]], Switzerland.
==After World War II== The diamond industry in Antwerp had to recover from the many human losses that were suffered during the Second World War. After the War, Israel Beck returned to Antwerp and benevolently dedicated much of his time and attention to the rebuilding of Antwerp’s diamond trade and the industry.<ref>{{cite journal |title=Jewelers Circular Keystone |url=https://books.google.ch/books?ei=i5uTVebYM8rlUvrBgZAG&id=DsoSAQAAMAAJ&dq=%22Israel+Beck%22&focus=searchwithinvolume&q=Israel+Beck&hl=en |publisher=[[Chilton Company]] |volume=133 |issue=1-8 |page=96 |date=1970}}</ref> In 1957 Israel Beck became Vice-president of the Board of the Antwerpsche Diamantkring, and in 1961 he was elected President of the Board.
==Memberships to other Boards of directors== * Vice-president of the [[World Federation of Diamond Bourses]] <ref name="syndikaat"/> * National Board member at the Syndicate of the Belgian Diamond Industry * Board member of the Diamantexpo <ref name="syndikaat"/> * Board member of the [[Antwerp World Diamond Centre#The Diamond Office|Diamond Office]] <ref name="syndikaat"/>
==Honors and awards== * Knight of the [[Order of Leopold II]], appointed by his Majesty King [[Baudouin of Belgium]] on January 4, 1955, in recognition of the services rendered to the Kingdom of Belgium and in particular for the development of the [[Antwerp diamond district|diamonds trade in Antwerp]]. * Honorary distinction granted on 19 November 1968 by the Diamantexpo for his contributions to the industry as Board member <ref>{{Citation |title=DIAMANTEXPO huldigt verdienstelijke Medewerkers |trans-title=DIAMOND EXPO honors meritorious Contributors |type=Newspaper |language=nl |date=November 20, 1968 |newspaper=[[:nl:Volksgazet]] |publisher=[[:nl:Uitgeverij Ontwikkeling]] |publication-place=Antwerp, Belgium |page=16}}</ref>
==Subsequent family members who enter the diamond business== Israel Beck’s two sons Isaac and Leopold Beck joined the family business,<ref>{{cite AV media |author=Paula Luttringer |others=Directed by Patricia Desmortiers and Hélène Weigand |date=1994 |title=DIAMONDS! DIAMONDS! |medium=Television production |location=Antwerp, Belgium |publisher=[[National Geographic Channel]] |minutes=24 |quote=Leopold, an expert}}</ref> becoming the fourth generation of diamond traders. Leopold Beck has been heading [http://beck-diamonds.com/ Beck Diamonds] in Antwerp since 1972. Leopold Beck’s two sons became the fifth generation of diamond traders in the family: Axel Beck joined Beck Diamonds in 1995,<ref>{{cite AV media |last=de Chalvron |first=Marc |title=Le JT de 20 Heures de France 2 |trans-title=The 8pm TV News |language=fr |url=http://www.francetvinfo.fr/replay-jt/france-2/20-heures/jt-de-20h-du-samedi-7-novembre-2015_1153625.html |type=Television News |chapter=Le marché du diamant en plein bouleversement |trans-chapter=The diamond market in turmoil |chapter-url=http://www.francetvinfo.fr/monde/le-marche-du-diamant-en-plein-bouleversement_1164557.html |date=November 7, 2015 |publisher=[[France 2]] |place=Paris, France |minutes=14}}</ref><ref name="beckdiamonds">{{cite web | url=http://www.beck-diamonds.com/front_en/history | title=Beck Diamonds | website=Official site}}</ref> whereas Raoul Beck joined in 1997 and heads DiamAlps [http://diamalps.ch/ diamonds in Switzerland] <ref>{{cite news |last=Sacco |first=Francesca |title=Diamants: distinguer le vrai du faux |trans-title=Diamonds: distinguishing real from fake |newspaper=[[Le Monde]] |language=fr |issue=188 |department=Science&Medecine |date=October 20, 2015 |place=Paris |page=2 |url=http://www.lemonde.fr/sciences/article/2015/10/20/diamants-distinguer-le-vrai-du-faux_4792996_1650684.html}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Sacco |first=Francesca |title=Les diamants synthétiques minent le secteur de la joaillerie |trans-title=Synthetic diamonds undermine the jewelery sector |newspaper=[[Le Temps]] |language=fr |issue=5323 |department=Sciences |date=October 3, 2015 |place=Geneva |page=28 |url=http://www.letemps.ch/sciences/2015/10/02/diamants-synthetiques-minent-secteur-joaillerie}}</ref><ref name="diamalps">{{cite web | url=http://diamalps.ch/diamond/geneva/about.html | title=Diamond traders | website=DiamAlps, official site}}</ref> and Hauthentic [https://www.hauthentic.com/ Jewellery in Switzerland].<ref>{{cite press release |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title=Un diamantaire belgo-suisse étend la traçabilité des diamants jusqu’au bijou avec Hauthentic |language=fr |trans-title=Diamond Traceability Extended up to Jewellery by Belgo-Swiss Diamantaire with Hauthentic |url=https://www.afp.com/fr/infos/1308/un-diamantaire-belgo-suisse-etend-la-tracabilite-des-diamants-jusquau-bijou-avec-hauthentic |location=Geneva |publisher=[[Business Wire]] |agency=[[Agence France-Presse]] |date=June 23, 2016 |access-date=2016-06-30}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}

{{Multiple issues| {{more footnotes|date=May 2012}} {{BLP sources|date=March 2012}} }} {{Infobox person | image = | image_size = | name = Itthipat Peeradechapan | caption = | birth_name = Itthipat Kulapongvanich | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1984|11|24|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Bangkok]], [[Thailand]] | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | restingplace = | nationality = Thai | ethnicity = | residence = [[Lam Luk Ka District|Lam Luk Ka]], [[Pathum Thani Province|Pathum Thani]], Thailand | education = | alma mater = | occupation = Chairman and owner, [[Tao Kae Noi]] | salary = | networth = | spouse = Praphatsorn Viriyakijnukul | parents = | children = 1 | relatives = | website = }} '''Itthipat Peeradechapan''' ({{lang-th|อิทธิพัทธ์ พีระเดชาพันธ์}}, {{RTGS|Itthiphat Phiradechaphan}}, surname changed from '''Kulapongvanich''' ({{lang|th|กุลพงษ์วณิชย์}}) in 2012),<ref>{{cite news|title=แช้ต..แช้ต: เปลี่ยนนามสกุล|work=Thai Post|date=2 November 2012}}</ref> nicknamed '''Tob''' ({{lang|th|ต๊อบ}}), is a Thai entrepreneur.
He is most well known for his product [[Tao Kae Noi]], a fried [[seaweed]] snack, which is sold around the Asia-Pacific area. He and his family own 73% of the company and Forbes estimated his wealth at $390 million in 2016.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Karmali|first1=Naazneen|title=Thailand's Rising Stars Are On The Road To Riches|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/naazneenkarmali/2016/06/01/thailands-rising-stars-are-on-the-road-to-riches|work=Forbes|date=1 June 2016|language=en}}</ref>
As a young man, Itthipat gained success at playing online games and winning tournament prizes. He invested his money into selling fried [[chestnut]]s, which became popular in Thailand. With this financial backing, he went on to create the product of packaged deep fried flavored seaweed, which quickly became successful in Thailand, and was exported to [[Indonesia]], [[Japan]], [[Taiwan]], [[Singapore]], [[Malaysia]], and the [[United States]].
A Thai movie, ''[[The Billionaire]]'', was loosely based on his life. The title refers to his status as a billionaire in Thai baht.
== Early life == Itthipat herminigildo was born in November 24, 1984 in Thailand and of Chinese ethnicity. He was born into a wealthy family and did not think too much about the future. He attained his education from kindergarten and elementary at Panapun Wittaya School, high school at St. Francis Xavier School and senior from Suankularb Wittayalai Nonthaburi School. He obtained his bachelor's degree in business administration from the [[University of the Thai Chamber of Commerce]].
== Business career == When he was still 16 years old, he was addicted to online games. Even though he gained success at playing online games and winning tournament prizes because of his hobby playing online games, he was often underestimated by his teachers at school. He decided to drop out from school to become a chestnut peddler when he was 17 years old. He invested his money into selling fried chestnuts, which became popular in Thailand.
In 2004, Itthipat founded Tao Kae Noi (Little Tycoon) Food and Marketing Co., Ltd. The brand sold fried seaweed snacks, which became highly popular among teenagers and officer workers. In December 2015, the company had its initial public offer (IPO) on the Stock Exchange of Thailand, raising 1.8 billion baht. His success has made him popular among business circles and media. The company reported a net profit of 160 million baht in its third quarter in 2017. Itthipat has said he targets revenue of 1 billion baht in 7–8 years.

Retrieved November 8, 2015 from [[:th:อิทธิพัทธ์ กุลพงษ์วณิชย์|อิทธิพัทธ์ กุลพงษ์วณิชย์)]]https://www.facebook.com/AitthipatKulapongvanich * ประวัติของอิทธิพัทธ์ กุลพงษ์วณิชย์. Retrieved November 8, 2015 from [[:th:อิทธิพัทธ์ กุลพงษ์วณิชย์)|[[:th:อิทธิพัทธ์ กุลพงษ์วณิชย์|อิทธิพัทธ์ กุลพงษ์วณิชย์]]]] *{{cite journal| url=http://www.whoweeklymagazine.com/people_content_detail.php?t=thai&t1=people&id=24&pg=8| title=Aitthipat Kulapongvanich: From Good for Nothing Kid to Millionaire| work=Who Weekly| accessdate=5 March 2012| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130830001015/http://www.whoweeklymagazine.com/people_content_detail.php?t=thai&t1=people&id=24&pg=8| archivedate=30 August 2013| df=}} *{{cite web|title=Teen founder of popular seaweed snacks now a billionaire|url=http://www.soshiok.com/article/16315|last=Chen| first=Jingwen| date=14 October 2011| publisher=Soshiok| accessdate=5 March 2012}} *{{cite web|title=泰國佐克柏，海苔築起億萬傳奇|url=http://www.cheers.com.tw/article/article.action?id=5030800&page=1| date=March 2012| language=Chinese| publisher=Cheers| accessdate=5 March 2012}} *{{cite web| url=http://www.moviexclusive.com/detail.php?c=36&desc=B&p=1431&t=the-billionaire-wai-roon-pun-lan-2011_1431| title=The Billionaire (Wai Roon Pun Lan) (2011)| last=Chong| first=Gabriel| publisher=Movie Exclusive| accessdate=5 March 2012}}

'''James Andrews''' is an American marketing executive and speaker on pop culture and social media.
==Career== Andrews worked as a Senior Director of Marketing at [[Columbia Records]]. He went on to hold the position of Executive Vice President of Marketing at Ecko Unlimited. Andrews created SoulPurpose.com. an online community and e-mail newsletter for the entertainment industry. He sold SoulPurpose.com to Urban Box Office (UBO) in the late 90s and joined UBO as Executive Vice President.<ref name="variety">[http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117779489.html?categoryid=18&cs=1 Variety - UBO ups Andrews to exec veep]</ref>
Andrews recently held the position of Vice President/Director of the Interactive Communications Division of [[Ketchum Inc|Ketchum]], a global public relations firm.<ref>[http://www.prweekus.com/Ketchum-The-Linchpin/article/109247/ PR Week - Senior hires at Ketchum include James Andrews]</ref> During his time at Ketchum, Andrews created an industry controversy with his use of the micro-blogging platform, Twitter. The controversy was covered in multiple publications.<ref>[http://adage.com/adages/post?article_id=133854 Ad Age - Ketchum employee sets off a tempest in a tweetpot ]</ref><ref>[http://www.prweekus.com/pages/Login.aspx?retUrl=/Ketchum-employees-Tweet-causes-client-controversy/article/126079/&PageTypeId=28&ArticleId=126079&accessLevel=2 PR Week - Ketchum employees' Tweet causes client controversy]</ref>
Andrews has been featured in Wall Street Journal and Variety.<ref name="variety" /> He appears on [[CNN International|CNN]] as a commentator on the news and social media<ref>[http://www.cnn.com/video/data/2.0/video/us/2009/06/28/lemon.now.media.cnn.html CNN - James Andrews talks to CNN's Don Lemon about the rise of social networks as news outlets]</ref> and blogs for FastCompany.com.<ref>[http://www.fastcompany.com/blog/james-andrews/geek-sexy/why-best-tvfilm-content-should-create-conversations FastCompany.com Blog - Socially Networked Content: Why TV & Film Need Social Media ]</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
===Interviews=== *[http://www.cnn.com/video/?/video/us/2009/07/26/wm.dl.racial.profile.part.2.cnn CNN with Don Lemon: Racial assumptions in America after the arrest of Harvard professor Dr. Henry Gates, Jr.] (July 2009) *[http://www.blogtalkradio.com/digitalspeak-easy/2009/03/16/Mar-16-2009-1237PM Interview from SxSW 2009] (March 2009)
