{{use dmy dates|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox Politician | name = İbrahim Bilgen | image = Bilgen.jpg | imagesize = 225px | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date|1949|3|2|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Batman, Turkey]] | death_date = {{death date and age|df=yes|2010|5|31|1949|3|2}} | death_place = On voyage from [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey]] to [[Ashdod]], [[Israel]] | signature = | website =http://www.trenbileti.com | party = [[Felicity Party]] | spouse = | religion = [[Sunni Islam]] }}
'''İbrahim Bilgen''' (2 March 1949 – 31 May 2010) was a [[Turkey|Turkish]] [[politician]], [[electrical engineer]] and [[activist]]. He was born in [[Batman, Turkey]] and killed by the Israeli armed forces in the [[Gaza flotilla raid]].
==Early life and education== Bilgen was born in [[Batman, Turkey|Batman]], to a family that had migrated to Turkey from [[Mosul]], [[Iraq]]. He graduated from [[Fırat University]], where he studied [[electrical engineering]], and was a member of the [[Chamber of Electrical Engineers of Turkey]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zaman.com.tr/wap.do?method=getMansetHaber&haberno=990887&sirano=3&sayfa=|title=Zaman|language=tr|publisher=Zaman|accessdate=26 July 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120229132736/http://www.zaman.com.tr/wap.do?method=getMansetHaber&haberno=990887&sirano=3&sayfa=|archivedate=29 February 2012|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He had been a resident of [[Siirt]], a south-eastern city of Turkey, since 1980. He was married and had six children.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.internethaber.com/siirt/siirtli-ibrahim-bilgen-israil-saldirinda-oldu-257196h.htm|title=Siirtli İbrahim Bilgen İsrail saldırında öldü|publisher=Internet Haber|accessdate=26 July 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://nationalpost.com/todays-paper/dead+wanted+martyrs/3105088/story.html|title=3 of dead wanted to be'martyrs'|newspaper=[[National Post]]|date=2 June 2010}}{{dead link|date=February 2013}}</ref>
==Political career== Bilgen was one of the founders of [[Virtue Party]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.siirtmanset.com/yardim-gemisinde-bulunan-hemsehrimiz-ibrahim-bilgen-sehit-oldu.htm |title=Siirt Manşet - Siirt Haber - Siirt Haberleri - Son Dakika Siirt Haberleri - Siirt Haberler - Siirt Kurtalan Haberler - Siirt Haber - Siirt Son Dakika Haberleri - Siirt Son Dakika - Siirt Manşet Haber |publisher=Siirtmanset.com |date= |accessdate=2010-07-26}}</ref> After the Virtue Party was banned by the [[Constitutional Court of Turkey]] in 2001, he joined the newly formed [[Felicity Party]]. He was a candidate for Member of Turkish Parliament in 2007 for that party for [[Siirt Province]], but he was not elected, the Felicity Party receiving 884 votes (0.96%) there.<ref>[http://www.saadet.org.tr/worde_aktar/saadet-partisinin-tam-listesi2]{{dead link|date=February 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.secimsonuclariturkiye.com/2007/56-Siirt-secim-sonuclari.html |title=Seçim Sonuçları 2007 SİİRT | Oy Oranları | Genel Seçim Sonuçları SİİRT |publisher=Secimsonuclariturkiye.com |date= |accessdate=2010-07-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100902123450/http://www.secimsonuclariturkiye.com/2007/56-Siirt-secim-sonuclari.html |archivedate=2 September 2010 }}</ref> In [[Turkish local elections, 2009]], he was a candidate for mayor of [[Siirt]], but he was again not elected.<ref name=bilgendead>{{cite web |url=http://www.internethaber.com/siirt/siirtli-ibrahim-bilgen-israil-saldirisinda-oldu-257196h.htm |title=Siirtli İbrahim Bilgen İsrail saldırısında öldü |publisher=Internethaber |accessdate=1 June 2010 |date=1 June 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeerah.info/News/2010/June/3%20n/8%20Turkish,%20One%20US%20Martyrs%20Arrive%20in%20Turkey,%20Together%20with%20the%20466%20Injured%20and%20Released%20After%20the%20Israeli%20Terrorist%20Attack%20on%20the%20Freedom%20Flotilla.htm |title=8 Turkish, One US Martyrs Arrive in Turkey, Together with the 466 Injured and Released After the Israeli Terrorist Attack on the Freedom Flotilla |publisher=Aljazeerah.info |date=2010-06-03 |accessdate=2010-07-26}}</ref> In a press interview during his 2009 campaign, he said: "I was born a Felicity man, I will die a Felicity man. Because Felicity is the only national party of Turkey. This party has neither come under the yoke of America, nor of any other country."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.milligazete.com.tr/haber/terorist-israil-360-kisiyi-rehin-aldi-165343.htm |title=Terörist İsrail 360 kişiyi rehin aldı |language=tr |publisher=Milli Gazete |date= |accessdate=2010-07-26}}</ref> Since then, he had been serving as a provincial inspector for the [[Felicity Party]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.internethaber.com/siirt/siirtli-ibrahim-bilgen-israil-saldirinda-oldu-257196h.htm |title=Siirtli İbrahim Bilgen İsrail saldırında öldü |publisher=Internethaber |accessdate=1 June 2010 |date=1 June 2010}}</ref>
==Business career== After working as an electrical engineer in various companies, İbrahim Bilgen founded an electrical engineering company called Bilgen Mühendislik, in 2004.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://bilgenmuhendislik.com/ |title=Şehit İbrahim Bilgen – Gazze Mavi Marmara |publisher=Bilgenmuhendislik.com |date=2010-06-18 |accessdate=2010-07-26}}</ref> In addition, he founded the first local television channel in Siirt, Selam TV.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.siirtanket.net/?p=2983 |title=Şehit İbrahim Bilgen İçin, Taziye Evi Kuruldu « Siirt Haber & Anket |publisher=Siirtanket.net |date= |accessdate=2010-07-26}}</ref>
==Death== As a volunteer for [[IHH (İnsani Yardım Vakfı)|IHH]] in [[Siirt]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.euractiv.com.tr/politika-000110/article/israil-saldirisinda-olen-4-turkten-biri-siirtli-saadet-partili-ibrahim-bilgen-010473 |title=İsrail saldırısında ölen 4 Türkten biri Siirtli Saadet Partili İbrahim Bilgen | Politika | EurActiv.com.tr – Türkiye’nin online AB Gazetesi |publisher=Euractiv.com.tr |date= |accessdate=2010-07-26}}</ref> Bilgen joined the Gaza flotilla of May 2010 on board the [[MV Mavi Marmara|MV ''Mavi Marmara'']], which set sail from [[Istanbul]] for the [[Gaza strip]] on May 23, 2010. He died on May 31, 2010, during the [[Gaza flotilla raid]].
According to an autopsy Bilgen died from four gunshot wounds to temple, chest, hip and back.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gaza flotilla activists were shot in head at close range|newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |author=Robert Booth |date=4 June 2010 |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2010/jun/04/gaza-flotilla-activists-autopsy-results }}</ref>
==Reactions to his death== *Afif Demirkıran, Member of Parliament for the [[AK Party]] from Siirt, said: "May Allah accept the martyrdom of İbrahim Bilgen."<ref>{{cite web|author=Siirt Haberleri |publisher=siirtliler.net |title=Siirt Son Dakika Haberleri |url=http://www.siirtliler.net/goster.asp?nereye=yazioku&ID=1138&Siirt_haberleri |date= |accessdate=2010-07-26}}</ref> *A press statement by the [[Chamber of Electrical Engineers of Turkey]] stated: "We condemn the attack of Israel in which one of our members was killed."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.emo.org.tr/genel/bizden_detay.php?kod=76272 |title=İsrail’İn Saldirisini Lanetle Kiniyoruz! |language=tr |publisher=EMO |date= |accessdate=2010-07-26}}</ref> *Photographs of İbrahim Bilgen were hung in the streets in Siirt.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.turkishweekly.net/news/102820/gaza-aid-flotilla-activists-arrive-in-turkey.html |title=Gaza Aid Flotilla Activists Arrive in Turkey |publisher=Turkish Weekly |date=3 June 2010 |accessdate=2013-02-10 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100702205726/http://www.turkishweekly.net/news/102820/gaza-aid-flotilla-activists-arrive-in-turkey.html |archivedate=2 July 2010 }}</ref> *[[Numan Kurtulmuş]], Felicity Party leader, held his photo during a press conference and called him a "martyr".<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.saadet.org.tr/haber/vahsete-ve-barbarliga-karsi-kararli-millet-cesur-devlet |title=Vahşete ve barbarlığa karşı: Kararlı millet, cesur devlet | Saadet Partisi | Prof. Dr. Numan Kurtulmuş |publisher=Saadet.org.tr |date= |accessdate=2010-07-26}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> *American author and journalist [[Ali Abunimah]] has reported a claim by [[Sheikh Raed Salah]], a leader of the [[Islamic Movement in Israel]] who was also on board the ''Mavi Marmara'', that Bilgen may have been deliberately targeted for execution by Israeli forces who mistook him for Raed Salah, and lists some pieces of circumstantial evidence that support this claim.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aliabunimah.posthaven.com/did-israel-try-to-assassinate-sheikh-raed-sal|title=Did Israel try to assassinate Sheikh Raed Salah on Mavi Marmara but kill a Turkish engineer instead? #flotilla - Ali Abunimah |publisher=aliabunimah.posthaven.com |date=2010-06-04 |accessdate=2014-07-26}}</ref>
